thread.title: Cheeky! Holly Willoughby gets a pat on the bum from a Teletubby on The One Show
thread.title_full: Cheeky! Holly Willoughby gets a pat on the bum from a Teletubby on The One Show

author: Joshua Haigh
title: Cheeky! Holly Willoughby gets a pat on the bum from a Teletubby on The One Show
text:
TV Cheeky! Holly Willoughby gets a pat on the bum from a Teletubby on The One Show The hoover from the legendary CBBC series gave the This Morning star a cheeky pat on the bum Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Noo Noo from the Teletubbies pokes Holly Willoughby's bum on The One Show Share this video Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Things got a little naughty during Holly Willoughby's appearance on The One Show. 
The This Morning star appeared on the BBC series to promote her new game show, but as the credits started to role she let out a shocked squeal. 
After taking part in a game with the Teletubbies earlier in the show, the children's TV show's hoover decided to play a game of his own with the blonde beauty. 
As Matt Baker said goodbye to viewers, the cheeky hoover crept up behind Holly and gave her a pat on the bottom. Holly got a cheeky pat from Noo Noo (Photo: BBC) She jumped back in shock (Photo: BBC) 
"Noo Noo!" exclaimed the former Blue Peter presenter as Holly covered her mouth in shock. 
Earlier in the show, Holly had tried to make friends with the hoover, but to no avail. So perhaps it was his way of making it up to the star. 
The Geordie lass, who won I'm A Celebrity in December, has already been snapped up to co-host Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway. Thankfully the This Morning host didn't seem to mind (Photo: BBC) Read More Broadchurch viewers praise show’s ‘harrowing’ return to former glory for series three 
Speaking to the Daily Star Sunday's television guide, TV Life, about her appearance on Play To The Whistle, she said: " Scarlett Moffatt was great. She gets up and in my chair at one point and hosts the show for a bit. 
"We were talking about how she wants to do more presenting, so I was like 'right, have a go!', and she did brilliantly. 
"Almost too good. I was like 'right, get out of my seat, now!'" she added. Like us on Facebook
